title: How to Solve the "Cannot Verify Server Identity" Error on iPhone

steps.title: This error is caused by unsuccessful syncing with Mail.
steps.content: This error is caused by unsuccessful syncing with Mail. The "Cannot Verify Server Identity" is usually caused by expired or bugged SSL certificates. An SSL certificate is what authenticates a website's identity and allows your device to connect. To fix this error, you'll need to ensure a secure connection. Follow the steps below to reconnect your Mail account to your server.

steps.title: Turn your iPhone off and on again.
steps.content: Turn your iPhone off and on again. Before you try any fixes, give your iPhone a restart . This can solve minor software bugs.

steps.title: Force-close the Mail app and open it again.
steps.content: Force-close the Mail app and open it again. If the Mail app has been running in the background for a long time, it may just need help loading new information. On iPhones without a Home button, swipe up from the bottom of the screen, hold, and then release. Swipe up on the Mail app to close it. Open it again. On iPhones with a Home button, double-press the Home button. Swipe up on the Mail app to close it. Open it again.

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. This is the grey cog icon.

steps.title: Tap Mail.
steps.content: Tap Mail . You'll need to scroll down to find this option.

steps.title: Tap Accounts.
steps.content: Tap Accounts . This will be at the center of the page. You'll see a list of all added email accounts on your iPhone.

steps.title: Tap the account.
steps.content: Tap the account. A new page will open.

steps.title: Tap Delete Account.
steps.content: Tap Delete Account . This is at the bottom in red font. You may need to tap Delete Account again to confirm. Return to the Accounts page.

steps.title: Add your email account again.
steps.content: Add your email account again. Tap Add Account at the bottom, select your provider, and enter the login information.

steps.title: Toggle off "Use SSL".
steps.content: Toggle off "Use SSL". The switch will turn grey.

steps.title: Make sure your iPhone has the latest software update.
steps.content: Make sure your iPhone has the latest software update. These updates provide important fixes. [2] X Research source To check for an update , do the following: Open Settings . Tap General . Tap Software Update . Tap Download and Install .
